info.title: ManagementLockClient
info.description: Azure resources can be locked to prevent other users in your organization from deleting or modifying resources.

get.description: Lists all of the available Microsoft.Authorization REST API operations.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

get.description: Gets all the management locks for a subscription.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of resource locks.

get.description: Gets a management lock at the subscription level.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of the lock to get.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the lock.

put.summary: Creates or updates a management lock at the subscription level.
put.description: When you apply a lock at a parent scope, all child resources inherit the same lock. To create management locks, you must have access to Microsoft.Authorization/* or Microsoft.Authorization/locks/* actions. Of the built-in roles, only Owner and User Access Administrator are granted those actions.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of lock. The lock name can be a maximum of 260 characters. It cannot contain <, > %, &, :, \, ?, /, or any control characters.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the lock.

201.description: Created - Returns information about the lock.

delete.summary: Deletes the management lock at the subscription level.
delete.description: To delete management locks, you must have access to Microsoft.Authorization/* or Microsoft.Authorization/locks/* actions. Of the built-in roles, only Owner and User Access Administrator are granted those actions.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of lock to delete.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

get.description: Gets all the management locks for a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group containing the locks to get.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of resource locks.

get.description: Gets a management lock at the resource group level.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the locked resource group.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of the lock to get.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the lock.

put.summary: Creates or updates a management lock at the resource group level.
put.description: When you apply a lock at a parent scope, all child resources inherit the same lock. To create management locks, you must have access to Microsoft.Authorization/* or Microsoft.Authorization/locks/* actions. Of the built-in roles, only Owner and User Access Administrator are granted those actions.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to lock.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The lock name. The lock name can be a maximum of 260 characters. It cannot contain <, > %, &, :, \, ?, /, or any control characters.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the lock.

201.description: Created - Returns information about the lock.

delete.summary: Deletes a management lock at the resource group level.
delete.description: To delete management locks, you must have access to Microsoft.Authorization/* or Microsoft.Authorization/locks/* actions. Of the built-in roles, only Owner and User Access Administrator are granted those actions.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group containing the lock.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of lock to delete.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

get.description: Gets all the management locks for a resource or any level below resource.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group containing the locked resource. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: resourceProviderNamespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the resource provider.

parameters.name: parentResourcePath
parameters.description: The parent resource identity.

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: The resource type of the locked resource.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the locked resource.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of resource locks.

get.description: Get the management lock of a resource or any level below resource.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: resourceProviderNamespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the resource provider.

parameters.name: parentResourcePath
parameters.description: An extra path parameter needed in some services, like SQL Databases.

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: The type of the resource.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the resource.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of lock.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

put.summary: Creates or updates a management lock at the resource level or any level below the resource.
put.description: When you apply a lock at a parent scope, all child resources inherit the same lock. To create management locks, you must have access to Microsoft.Authorization/* or Microsoft.Authorization/locks/* actions. Of the built-in roles, only Owner and User Access Administrator are granted those actions.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group containing the resource to lock.

parameters.name: resourceProviderNamespace
parameters.description: The resource provider namespace of the resource to lock.

parameters.name: parentResourcePath
parameters.description: The parent resource identity.

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: The resource type of the resource to lock.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the resource to lock.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of lock. The lock name can be a maximum of 260 characters. It cannot contain <, > %, &, :, \, ?, /, or any control characters.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

requestBody.description: Parameters for creating or updating a  management lock.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the lock.

201.description: Created - Returns information about the lock.

delete.summary: Deletes the management lock of a resource or any level below the resource.
delete.description: To delete management locks, you must have access to Microsoft.Authorization/* or Microsoft.Authorization/locks/* actions. Of the built-in roles, only Owner and User Access Administrator are granted those actions.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group containing the resource with the lock to delete.

parameters.name: resourceProviderNamespace
parameters.description: The resource provider namespace of the resource with the lock to delete.

parameters.name: parentResourcePath
parameters.description: The parent resource identity.

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: The resource type of the resource with the lock to delete.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: The name of the resource with the lock to delete.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of the lock to delete.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

get.description: Gets all the management locks for a scope.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope for the lock. When providing a scope for the assignment, use '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}' for subscriptions, '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourcegroups/{resourceGroupName}' for resource groups, and '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourcegroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{parentResourcePathIfPresent}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}' for resources.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of resource locks.

get.description: Get a management lock by scope.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope for the lock.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of lock.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

put.description: Create or update a management lock by scope.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope for the lock. When providing a scope for the assignment, use '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}' for subscriptions, '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourcegroups/{resourceGroupName}' for resource groups, and '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourcegroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{parentResourcePathIfPresent}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}' for resources.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of lock.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

requestBody.description: Create or update management lock parameters.

delete.description: Delete a management lock by scope.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope for the lock.

parameters.name: lockName
parameters.description: The name of lock.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

id.description: The resource ID of the lock.

type.description: The resource type of the lock - Microsoft.Authorization/locks.

applicationId.description: The application ID of the lock owner.

level.description: The level of the lock. Possible values are: NotSpecified, CanNotDelete, ReadOnly. CanNotDelete means authorized users are able to read and modify the resources, but not delete. ReadOnly means authorized users can only read from a resource, but they can't modify or delete it.

notes.description: Notes about the lock. Maximum of 512 characters.

operation.description: Operation type: Read, write, delete, etc.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: Profile, endpoint, etc.

display.description: The object that represents the operation.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

OperationListResult.description: Result of the request to list Microsoft.Authorization operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for the operation.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The ID of the target subscription.
